title.narrative: Un-Habitat - Gangwon Province Partnership To Develop Local Government Capacity In Asian And The Pacific Region

description.narrative: 2.3 Project’s PurposeThe International Urban Training Centre aims to build capacities of local governments to be increasingly in the position to face the outlined challenges. The IUTC aims to provide training and capacity development activities in close collaboration with UN-HABITAT: The IUTC aims on doing so by jointly organizing courses which are address priority concern to UN-HABITAT and by attracting participants recommended by UN-HABITAT projects. The latter would ensure local follow up.The IUTC has also partnered with UCLG-ASPAC, ESCAP, training and capacity development providers in Asia and the Pacific to constantly keep abreast of current training needs as well as training and capacity development methodology.The IUTC will provide UN-HABITAT with the unique opportunity to organize priority training courses by providing training facilities, training management, and the financial and human resources to provide.2.4 Describe project’s alignment to local, national, regional, global priorities.The International Urban Training Centre is a flexible training provider. Whilst it has so far specialized in urban environmental issues (within the broader context of urban sustainability), it has since 2010 ventured into other urban issues such as housing and urban revitalization. The partnership focuses on training for participants from developing countries in Asia and the Pacific. The training programmes is constantly fine-tuned to incorporate emerging issues.The training is process oriented and to a very large extent addresses the specific needs of the participants who bring to the course their (unresolved) case studies.
